alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 10:04AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Sugar Creek from Near Milford downstream to confluence with Iroquois River at Watseka, including the Milford gauge. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, County road 1090N threatened east of the river north of Milford. Recreation fields inundated near the river in southwest Milford. Roadways are threatened at Legion Park in Watseka. At 19.0 feet, Structures threatened in southwest Milford. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by late tonight.
